website_summaries.verdict: This headset comes at a great price point without sacrificing performance, making it an impressive value.
pros: Bargain price headset that provides clear sound quality
Noise cancellation feature on microphone is a nice touch
Lightweight design makes this headset comfortable to wear
These provide good sound quality for listening to music, too, making them a solid multi-purpose purchase
cons: This headset does not have a mute button

customer_reviews.title: Can You Hear Me Now? This Was a Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This headphone is a low cost replacement for my more expensive Dragon headphones replacement. The cord that's attached to the Dragon headphone keeps breaking and replacing the headset multiple times was getting expensive so I decided to give these low-cost headphones a chance. Surprisingly they work really well with my Dragon dictation software. The only problem that I have is that the band could be more flexible so that it would sit better on my head. For the price this definitely is an affordable headphone set for simple dictations and yes I'm glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M.Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: A year later and they are still doing great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these sets over a year ago and they are still performing like a champ today. They have definitely performed beyond my expectations and trust me, I have put a good amount of use into them. For $10-15, you can't go wrong. Great sound, great mic, and durable build construction.
customer_reviews.author: boyscouT

customer_reviews.title: This headset works great on PS4
customer_reviews.text: This headset works great on PS4. For anyone who is curious, these will not work on Xbox One. Also tested this headset on Windows 7, 10 and several Linux distributions with no problems. The cord is very long, a bit long for PC use (tied mine up for PC use) but is well suited for console play if you have the console a 5-6 feet from your chair. Be wary of having the volume up, as my friends would note on how loud I sound when talking into the Mic. Other headsets I have used did not produce the same volumes this headset did.
customer_reviews.author: Bob, tech guy

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: The metal usb part bent and broke within the month. I have never had this happen before. I was outside my return window. Could not find how to contact the seller so here it is. I would not suggest this product because the part that plugs into the computer is cheaply made and or defective. It bends or comes apart easily. The headset is nicely made, just the plug is not matching in quality.
customer_reviews.author: Gee Matts

customer_reviews.title: wrong connector shown
customer_reviews.text: I needed a USB port connector. The bullet said that it was an 8' foot USB port connector. I bought it. It had two small round port connectors which did not work for my computer. I could hear but the mic connector did not work. I returned it and ordered a second one more expensive from Koss and had the same problem with it. No more Koss orders for me. I did get a refund but had to complain the second time to get it.
customer_reviews.author: MarilynLA

customer_reviews.title: ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this when everyone else was buying tech stuff for working at home. Sound quality is fine, but didn't find the headset really comfortable. It also stopped working - although that may have been operator error :). have already replaced it after just three weeks with a more comfortable headset, plus an additional earpiece type headset. This is a fine unit for the price I guess, but fit was an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie J. Peacock

customer_reviews.title: Made for tiny headed people. My head (size 7) is considered small for normal people.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get to try it out... Right out of the box I tried it on and found it was to tight, I tried to loosen it by widening the head strap only to find out the plastic is non-malleable and it broke. It would have been nice if it had steel wire in it so it could be formed to fit. It broke pretty easily, no flexibility. I am of course very disappointed, not everybody has a tiny head. I'm going to try and rig something up, so I can attach it to my ear. Wish me good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Ecotechster

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: The USB one worked better for me – it works as headphone for Dragon nicely. I fully recommend this. Great value for money. Stopped working after a year. Just dead. I think the wire inside the joint that connects the mouth piece to the head band is likely broken. I bought another one (inexpensive and works) but decided not to close the mouth piece-just leave it as it is so as not to stress the joint (the company should design better).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Crappy material, design and i regret buying these very much. Headset has a nasty curve on the speaker less side that will NOT bend out.....imagine having a nice firm piece of plastic trying to force it's way into your skull through constant pressure....
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: Poor USB connection design
customer_reviews.text: Headset worked great for a few months, but USB connection is about 2" long. Because of how long the connector is it sticks out from the computer and gets knocked, pulled and eventually broke. Replaced it with different product that has a shorter connection and have had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Brant Christensen

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this to use with my windows 7 Desktop ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with my windows 7 Desktop and the free Windows 7 voice recognition software. My computer did not recognize the headset and it did not work. I called Koss and they told me that it was plug-and-play and it should work with no drivers needed. And if it didn't work it was probably defective and I should return it. Which I did and I opted for the dragon Voice recognition software that includes a headset for nearly the same price from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Bart M. Aiello

customer_reviews.title: Good headset
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is excellent and the mic is quite sensitive. The mic sensitivity is high enough that I have to turn down the mic volume to about 50%. The lack of mute button that has been reported in other reviews isn't an issue for me - my old headset had it and I never used it. I'm on a Linux system and it works perfectly with Skype and Microsoft Teams. My only complaint (and its very minor) is that the piece that rests against your head should have a little padding.
customer_reviews.author: R. Little

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I got to the point that I needed to use a dictation program to help me with my typing. The program offered a headset that they include in their package. I reviewed it and decided I would rather have a different one. The one I chose is the one I'm wearing what I am dictating this review. The Koss Communications USB Headset with Microphone was my choice. So far it is working just fine.
customer_reviews.author: PastorJuan

customer_reviews.title: Headset Hurts
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend this product. The piece that sits on the side of the head broke as soon as I took it out of the box and placed it on my head. The headset was tight around my head and I don't have a large head. It is very uncomfortable and had to send back. As far as looks, it is very nice and I hated to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Mom 2019

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monaural headphone for people with single-side deafness
customer_reviews.text: I have single-side deafness and been searching for a good mono (over-ear) headphone for years. This is the first quality one I have found. Reproduces sound excellently, much better than other mono headphones, with bass that has been missing from every other headphone I've used. Though not specifically a sound-canceling headphone, the Koss CS95 does a decent job of that, too. The only improvement I could wish for is a way to detach the microphone part (as I don't need it), but I realize that my needs are outside of its intended usage. I have written to the company to thank it for a great product and to inquire about the availability of a version without the microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: only had one problem
customer_reviews.text: this has been a great little headset, but I only had one problem...the USB is so long that it has become bent there (using a laptop which I sometimes have tipped over due to a cat sitting on my lap while I work from home) The sound is great and it picks up my voice great, but I'm now getting errors because of the bent USB.
customer_reviews.author: SSBDW

customer_reviews.title: Works well for Dragon Naturally Speaking but not very comfortable on my head
customer_reviews.text: I got this headset to use with Dragon Naturally Speaking. It works very well with that software. I had no problems with it technically. I simply had to run it through the training wizard in Dragon, which I had already done previously for a handheld recording device I had purchased previously. The one negative is a fairly big one, though. The headset presses too tightly into my skull on the opposite side of the earphone. When I need to use this for many hours at a time, that's a very uncomfortable downside. I rate this product 5 stars for how well it works and 2 stars for comfort. Overall, 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kate McMurryTop Contributor: Health & Wellness

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, poor comfort.
customer_reviews.text: These are not very comfortable. Maybe I just have a big head but the off-ear support piece is stiff and pushes very hard against my skull rather than down alongside. The only adjustment is up and down on the ear piece and since the whole things is a bit small, that side presses too. Sound does appear to be good and I haven't used the microphone yet. My previous headphones were a different brand and I wore those out. For the price, I suppose these will work. If you're going for a long term session, you'll want something that is more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Silcox

customer_reviews.title: I love these microphones!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these microphones. I bought this one after the first one give out. I've been using this for quite a while and I'm very happy with it. It's great for Dragon NaturallySpeaking or other speech recognition software. It is also great for talking on Skype. The only drawback is that the boom is stiff and not that flexible so compared to other microphones this one doesn't get as close to your mouth. Despite this drawback it doesn't negatively affect accuracy when using Dragon NaturallySpeaking so I'm satisfied because I never liked having the microphone close to my mouth in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley G.

customer_reviews.title: Koss CS95 Headset
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in order to start using the speech recognition program that is part of Windows 7. It worked very well and I only had to repeat a couple of words the program didn't understand - and that might well be due to my accent rather than the headset! It was comfortable to wear for more than an hour on a couple of different occasions. The only problem was that our kitten decided he liked the cord as a play toy and promptly perforated it in 5 different places so that it fell apart. It is good enough, however, that I intend to re-order this headset and I am surprised that it doesn't cost more.
customer_reviews.author: L. Spence

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were ok until it stopped working within 6 months, the headphones don't work anymore but the mic still does so I use it for the mic only because it's at least better than my acer standard laptop mic, but because it did not live up to the reviews I'm giving it one star, the mic isn't even that clear but I guess for 11 bucks you get what you pay for, I recommend spending a little more on a 5 star rating headset, but i'm also starting to think reviews are biased due to being bought off by the companies so it may be a little bit of a risk, just my two cents.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Nice headset
customer_reviews.text: We are using this with a program that teaches a second language so, it requires you to use the microphone most of the time. The ear piece keeps sounds very clear. It is very appealing to the eye and comfortable to wear. I only gave this product 4 stars because you have to have the microphone right up to the mouth or your voice is not picked up very clearly. However, once you get the right placement, it does pick up the voice clearly.
customer_reviews.author: panda

customer_reviews.title: Rigid plastic is too narrow for comfort
customer_reviews.text: Using after the headset that came with Dragon Naturally speaking broke. The voice recognition quality is less than the OEM, but the biggest irk is the distance between the molded plastic and the earphone (where one's head is supposed to go is about 1.5" wide. Now, I may have a bigger head than most but this would fit a garden gnome perfectly. So, if that's you, ignore the lack of stars and purchase away! The pressure for me is quite a bit and I use this daily. I still use it because I need to, but I'll keep shopping for a different one when I wear this one out. .
customer_reviews.author: Skitch P.

customer_reviews.title: Doing the job for me.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this headset for some strange reasons. I am totally deaf in one ear and this headset actually combines both right and left channels into the single earphone, so I can hear everything. That alone would rate them highly in my eyes (ears). The mic seems to work OK, although I've only used it for a little bit of speech recognition stuff so far. If I had any complaint it would be that they do fit a bit tight and can get uncomfortable after an hour or so. Still, I will probably get them again when these die.
customer_reviews.author: TimDouglass

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The previous one I had lasted years! When it broke after it was crushed under heavy weight, I was hoping to find the same one again. Fortunately, I did! and I am so glad I did! This is a very strong and durable product. It is comfortable and does not put too much pressure on the ears or the head. Love it due to its very strong qualities.
customer_reviews.author: ACM

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: My computer does not have a microphone, but I needed one for a homework project using voice recognition. I bought this headset for that purpose. It does not get much use, but is more than adequate for the school project.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Decent Basic Headset
customer_reviews.text: This headset is a decent value, but the design could use some improvement. The band doesn't adjust comfortably enough for me. I have a big head, which is a factor, but I find it to be stiff even at the largest setting. The piece opposite the earphone tends to dig in a bit. The sound is fairly decent, not too tinny or harsh. I do wish it had an inline volume control and mute function. I guess at this price point, that's not a standard feature. The microphone is adjustable and it works well. I would recommend this headset for anyone looking for a budget-friendly option without a lot of bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.author: ams78

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: A good product. Sometimes I'm happy it only has one headphone, especially if you'd still like to listen to something on the computer but also know what's going on around you. On the other hand, I do wish it had two at times. The quality of the mic differs depending on your voice, I'd say; I can be clear one minute and scratchy the next, but the mic is bendy, so it can sometimes bend out of proper proportions. It's all in all a good product, though.
customer_reviews.author: The Pipe Fox

customer_reviews.title: Okay quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: My wife is starting to do online tutoring and needed a headset. This looked like our best affordable option with favorable reviews, so we picked this one up. When it arrived, the earphone was dangling by the cord. Not a good first impression, but after I snapped it back into the mount, everything seemed to work fine. Sound quality is good and the headset is reasonably comfortable albeit a little snug. It doesn't feel like high quality, but is reasonable given the price. Worth a try if you need a headset for cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Chilehead Craig

customer_reviews.title: Small heads only
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 3 different brands in this price range. I found that this one had middle-of-the-road sound and as others have pointed out the headset is very tiny. I have a friend with a very small child-sized head. I gave it to her and she loves it. I would recommend for those with very small heads or for children. Pretty good price for a pretty sturdy item. The microphone swings up and down well, but stays in place after you put it where it is comfortable for you. Not recommended for large heads.
customer_reviews.author: Ziminy13

customer_reviews.title: This was a replacement.... and it ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement....and it stopped working this week...Its been less than a year and I only use it for work at home job...this one I was not using lately as I got a different headset. But I went back to this one the last couple months....Are these units not meant to last longer than 6 to 8 months..
customer_reviews.author: T. Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: Unboxed it, pluged it in, was gaming and chatting within 1 minute, definitely recommend as a cheap functional microphone
customer_reviews.text: On par with an XBOX gaming headset in terms of quality of construction; super good sound/recording quality with the added convenience of USB plug and play. I primarily use this for gaming since I prefer to use my surround sound speakers for sound instead of a headset; having a microphone with a single ear piece cover is a dream. Only drawback is it looks like something you'd expect a telemarketer to be using, not a visually appealing accessory whatsoever, if that matters to you anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Blake London

customer_reviews.title: very clear, great volume
customer_reviews.text: Using with Skype and Microsoft Lync for business calls. Earpad very comfortable. Microphone very loud and crystal clear (or so i'm told). USB cable is fairly long. Sometimes gets a bit tangled sitting around. USB plug is large and my laptop only has USB jacks on side so sticks out some. Wish it had volume/mute in-line. Number of times i couldn't hit mute when house phone rang, kids walk in talking, etc. Price was great but wish i paid few dollars more for in-line mute/volume controls.
customer_reviews.author: pStove

customer_reviews.title: Read below for pencil idea, much better!
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made with sharp edges on the side without the ear piece. Really likes to cut into your head, the surface area should be much larger and rounded. Not ideal for large heads. In fact, stabbing a pencil into your temple and dangling an earbud from it would be more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: dom085

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't played much with them but they work great so far! I have a web conference coming up and am looking forward to giving them a good workout. I've tested them and they work great, so I'm confident everything will go well.
customer_reviews.author: Psi

customer_reviews.title: TINY HEADS ONLY
customer_reviews.text: This thing is itty bitty. Like expanded all the way it hurt to wear and I could t even try to keep it on. Way too small for the average adult head.
customer_reviews.author: eas_413

customer_reviews.title: Very good headset
customer_reviews.text: I use this headset for voip over my computer, as well as my tablet. It has excellent quality sound. The mic provides excellent sound to the person at the other end.
customer_reviews.author: KentR

customer_reviews.title: a good basic set of headphones but
customer_reviews.text: i didn't want to spend a lot on something i would not use all that often so based on the reviews i picked these out. they arrived quickly and as far as quality there are no problems. the one problem i have however is that they are very uncomfortable and don't fit well. you get what you pay for and for that reason i really shouldn't complain but i would not recommend these to anyone who plans to use them a lot due to fit and comfort. otherwise a good inexpensive headset.
customer_reviews.author: MikenzCO

customer_reviews.title: Good for occasional use.
customer_reviews.text: Good for my weekly video chats and voip calling. It works great for my needs. (Had to get the 2 to 1 adapter cable for my Chromebook though.) If I was a daily user, I would part with a few more bucks and get a sturdier headset. I do like the one side earpiece the mic is clear. Good item for the price. p.s. I used the hairdryer to warm the blank side up and take a strange bend out of it from the packaging. That side was rolled under a bit and wasn't comfortable. Good to go now.
customer_reviews.author: JDH

customer_reviews.title: Strange initial head shape, but easily fixed with gentle stretching
customer_reviews.text: I use this for speech to text on an HP windows 10 laptop computer and the accuracy is pretty good for the price point. Only 4 stars because The shape of the head pad turns in strangely on the headset to start and had to be bent and stretched gently over a few days by putting it onto a round object to stop digging painfully into my skull.
customer_reviews.author: average buyer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.  Use on my Computer to Answer my Office Voip Phone
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this USB headset after I purchased the cheaper iMicro headset which didn't work and had to be returned. Works great. I like the fact that it only covers one ear so I can talk to other people in the room when I have the headset on. I use it on my work computer to receive VOIP telephone calls over my computer. Works better than the wireless headset I have on my Voip CISCO Phone.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gaiser

customer_reviews.title: additional component may be required for it to work
customer_reviews.text: It never worked, why because apparently you have to buy a separate component to power it up if your laptop isn't equipped with the compatible power source. They should at least put that part into the description before you go through all the trouble of trying to figure out why it doesn't work. By the way they are well aware of this because when you call customer support the first thing they ask is did you purchase a power jack (not sure if that's what its called).Figure out if your computer will power it up before you purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mountain man

customer_reviews.title: Happy for Amazon's return policy and will go back to ...
customer_reviews.text: Was really looking forward to getting these. However, after about 30 minutes of wearing them they REALLY begin to hurt my head on the side that does not have the speaker. I didn't watch the video provided, so perhaps this is my fault, but the side without the speaker cuts in at an almost 45 degree angle and pushes very very hard against my head. Will go back to the drawing board.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've had this headset for a few months but have only used it in class for about a month. Often times my computer wouldn't even read the headset or it couldn't understand what I was saying through the mic. Now my wire has broke during my semester and I'm left without a headset to complete my assignments. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just the One for Voice Recognition
customer_reviews.text: I use this one with Dragon - works great. Dragon gets it right 99% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: George the Bookman

customer_reviews.title: Great headset
customer_reviews.text: Great little headset. It's lightweight and comfortable. It's easy to use, just plug in the USB and it's ready to go. I bought 2 and one was defective, no audio from the ear. Called Amazon, they sent me a return UPS label and sent a replacement right away, they crossed in transit. The second one now works great
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Speech to Text Mic
customer_reviews.text: This is a really amazing product. In the past I have paid a lot more for the same and or less quality than I get with this headset and mic. I have used it almost every day since I received it. In fact, I am using it right now to write this review. I use it with my PC and a speech to text program. It works very well. I am extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wambui Bey

customer_reviews.title: not too comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality, but maybe I just have a big head but the headset is tight on me. I decided to keep it because the sound quality is good
customer_reviews.author: Stewart B. Schachner

customer_reviews.title: Great headset.
customer_reviews.text: Great headset. There are more expensive headsets out there that are not as good as this one. Rotate function on the microphone allows you to use the earpiece on either ear. Audio quality of incoming sound was good. I was told by people I was communicating with that the sound they were receiving from me was excellent, with very little background noise. Noise reduction function on the microphone works pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Dragon Naturally Speaking
customer_reviews.text: Despite product claim that it is "Ideal for PC voice applications, interactive gaming & speech recognition," it does not work with Dragon Naturally Speaking. Did not check use for other applications. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: mttblvd

customer_reviews.title: "Inexpensive, But Not Worth It"
customer_reviews.text: 2-and-a-half stars for this. Pros: 1.) Microphone works well and is flexible to adjust where you want it. Cons: 1.) Only one earphone, 2.) Headset squeezes too tight on your head and will give you a headache for extended use, 3.) Connection cord wire is way too skimpy, skimpy, skimpy and damages easily around the connectors.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Hill

customer_reviews.title: Started cutting out after about 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and when I first received this headset it worked great. About 5 months later I started getting complaints from my teammates that I would cut in and out when I was training or facilitating a meeting. It is very comfortable to wear, but definitely expected this to last longer than 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work well. Spend a few more dollars and get a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't too sure about ordering this, but I needed a new mic and didn't want to get the traditional headset with headphones over both ears. This is very nice... light weight... picks up my voice well without picking up background noises. I'm very happy with it and have considered ordering another for down the road if this one breaks. haha
customer_reviews.author: Shaeliana

customer_reviews.title: Just Okay - Koss CS95 Speech Recognition Computer Headset
customer_reviews.text: The Koss CS95 Speech Recognition Computer Headset works just okay for me. The product was packaged well and delivered on time. I gave the product three stars, because I am not sure if the errors are due to the headset, or the Speech Recognition program I am using. In either case the product is comfortable, the mic position is easily adjustable, as is the headset itself. The one major drawback is that the earpiece has the foam cover which wears out quickly.
customer_reviews.author: TEDDY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Speech Recognition
customer_reviews.text: I bought this headset to use with my Dragon NaturallySpeaking Essentials software ( It works great. The mic is super sensitive and completely adjustable. The headset itself if also adjustable and it doesn't hurt my head even after a few hours of wearing it. The cord is pretty long, so I'm also able to pace back and forth by the computer while dictating letters and emails. For the price, this is one of the better headset mics you're going to find.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep a connection for some reason.
customer_reviews.text: Unit works well when it is working but has a tendency to drop off losing the USB connection. No other devices are doing this (have several other headsets-full stereo) that don't drop off so I think it is this unit. I prefer to use a non-stereo headset when on the phone since I can't hear myself speak with full stereo and I start to talk funny.
customer_reviews.author: DesertWanderer

customer_reviews.title: Works with my MMO!
customer_reviews.text: I picked this mic up to play Dungeons and Dragons Online. It works and allowed me to hear and be heard reasonably well, though the sound quality was worse than the xbox 360 mic over Live according to some of the people I was playing with (and usually play with on Xbox). It's definitely not the most comfortable headset and a very basic setup without any kind of mute button or volume control on the headset, but it is functionable and for under $12, 4 stars! Just be prepared to rip it off quickly when you feel that sneeze coming on during your gaming session!
customer_reviews.author: Logan D

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The headset is junk! The headband was curled in in such a way it hurts your head. The designers did not at all take user comfort into consideration. It is clunky and does not fit the head or ear well. In a very short while I was tired of how the headband fit so I attempted to stretch it out and the headband snapped, of course, because there is no design for adjustments either. I have found cheaper units with more features that make more sense. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer-B-Where?

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous headset! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and needed a reliable headset. Some of the girls I work with recommend this one and it’s been great. It’s very clear and I’ve had no issues with dropped calls or anyone having trouble hearing or understanding me. I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Dixie

customer_reviews.title: Works well but not very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for conference calls in the office. Works well, but I get a weird cramp in my jaw and a headache when i wear it more than 15 minutes because of the side that doesn't have a headset on it. it's like the pad jams into my head. If it weren't for that, I would highly recommend it. I really like that the mic can swivel so you can wear the speaker headset on the left or right ear.
customer_reviews.author: doliodude

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but uncomfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but it's very uncomfortable to wear and tight on the head (I think my head is probably smaller than the average person), so I usually have it around my neck instead. I would recommend buying a different headset if comfort is important to you while wearing the headset.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: although it seems in good working order
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware: there is a USB model and stereo model with separate speaker/mic jacks. This is the latter. It is lightweight but also durable. The speaker is very clear. I have not extensively tested the mic, although it seems in good working order.
customer_reviews.author: Habib Jamar Rafiki

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it, it comes with LOTS of static.
customer_reviews.text: The headset creates significant static and people can't hear me when I place calls or leave voicemails. I wasn't aware it was the headset causing me this issue until today when I happened to try to plug it in midway through the call. I thought it was my internet connection and thus had never tried to return the headset within the 30 day window required by Amazon for returns. They said I needed to talk directly to the manufacturer who didn't answer the phone. I emailed them today to see what their response will be.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan S.

customer_reviews.title: Either it is poor quality or the Toshiba is but it didn't work well at all.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work well at all with my Toshiba computer which is now 6 years old. My ipad works well without any device as does my new iphone 6s.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bethke

customer_reviews.title: not very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I don't have that large of a head but the main top part is very narrow. There isn't enough cushioning on the piece opposite the speaker. The large/longer USB plug than normal is a little annoying (I've seen this on other headsets too.) I like how adjustable the mic boom is and it works pretty well. Not worth returning I'll use it as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: skyrunr

customer_reviews.title: Super-uncomfortable. That spike on the right is supposed to ...
customer_reviews.text: Super-uncomfortable. That spike on the right is supposed to anchor it to your head, I think. It's excruciating. I tried putting cotton under it. Doesn't help much. Splurge for the one that covers both ears.
customer_reviews.author: calamityj

customer_reviews.title: Causes a Headache with bad design
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product as an add-on to Dragon Home 12.0. The side that has the clip (non-ear phone side) puts so much pressure on the head that it actually hurts. I tried bending it outward to the point of breaking but it still puts too much pressure on the head. Turns out Dragon has a headset in the box with the software that is free and much more comfortable. Were it not for the cost, I would have sent it back. I find the best headsets are the ones with two ear phones, not just one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is good which is the most important thing to me
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is good which is the most important thing to me. The only complaint that I have is the comfort of the headset. The fit is a little tight for me, but I am hoping it will loosen with use. Adjusting the headset up didn't ease the tightness. It isn't too bad, just wish it was a little more comfortable. Overall great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: L. Marie

customer_reviews.title: Best Sound of Three Mics I reviewed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, the MS lifechat and logitech h390 at the same time, and then did mp3 samples and listened back to them. The Koss had the best sound because it conveys some of your natural bass, more like a radio announcer would sound like- the bass is what gives them some authority. The other two were tinny sounding. The Koss CS95 is not the most comfortable one, but it's not uncomfortable- I expected the one side with no ear would irritate my head but it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: L. M. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy headset.
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderfully with my computer and I love the USB port instead of the headphone jack that's normally standard. Currently using it with Dragon to assist a blind senior to write her own biography and a romance novel and the microphone captures everything wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: KRandles

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive headset / mic for voice dictation, voice calls and gaming
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement headset with dual analog connectors (not USB). This does NOT have a USB connector and is most convenient if you can use the front panel audio jacks on your desktop computer (1 for the speaker and a separate 1 for the mic). Very durable and has a long cord. Sound quality is great and other folks can hear you very well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wardekar

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Clear as a bell. People can hear me and I can hear them. Nice long cord, I can move around my desk works pulling on the cord. Quality I would expect from Koss!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: We've settled on this one as a good match for relatively frequent use for VOIP phone use
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these to use as telephone headsets for our computers in our small office. They are drystal clear and unobtrustive. We tried two other inexpensive cordless headsets with various levels of success. We've settled on this one as a good match for relatively frequent use for VOIP phone use. We concluded this corded version wins over the cordless ones we tried, even though it lacks the freedom of movement of a cordless set.
customer_reviews.author: David Paseo

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if these are advertised as 'noise cancelling' but if you're in an open space you sound like your in a tunnel
customer_reviews.text: I just needed these for training. Not sure if these are advertised as 'noise cancelling' but if you're in an open space you sound like your in a tunnel. However, they worked fine for what I needed them for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK, not Great...
customer_reviews.text: They are flimsy, cheap, and sound just OK. Be reminded that this requires an output plug for the headphone part, and an input plug for the mic. You can't use on a MacBook Air, or Pro with only one plug for the Mic / Headphone IN/OUT. I didn't know that, so was not able to use on my Apple product. However, it's not much to use at any rate, and money could be better spent on a product that is a bit more expensive, and better quality.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dean Waterman

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and Effective
customer_reviews.text: With it only being on one ear it is not designed to cancel out noise. The headset is very efficient and effective especially in a work from home environment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Really decent sound clarity and affordable. They are a little snug across the head which may cause a little pressur owith extended wear but its only been a few hours so far. They wont slide off when you drop your pen that is for sure. Bendable mike with a really long cord that measures 105 inches, Yea crazy long but great for someone like me who rolls all over the office but is too cheap for a wireless set up.
customer_reviews.author: Bette Noir

customer_reviews.title: Listen to me!
customer_reviews.text: This works so that people can clearly hear me say silly things online. The sound quality is just average, but the price can't be beat. if you need a cheap headset that actually works for gaming and telecom, here it is!
customer_reviews.author: Cg

customer_reviews.title: very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: It digs into my head and pulls my hair. Then when I looked at the stereo version, for the same price I could get one with a mute and volume control. (Logitech clearchat) I like that one better and returned the Koss. Kudos, though to Koss for cardboard packaging which was easy to open and easy to replace for a return.
customer_reviews.author: SA Val

customer_reviews.title: Good for gaming, not for office work.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the design on this headset, but the clarity wasn't as good as I had hoped for. This would be good for gaming aspects, but not for day to day office work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I liked this head set
customer_reviews.text: I liked this head set. The sound was fine. The microphone seems to work well. The only thing I didn't like was the fit. They are uncomfortable. the rubber pad on the left side is tight and leaves a sore spot after wearing them for a while.
customer_reviews.author: William lantz

customer_reviews.title: Works okay on second try.
customer_reviews.text: First pair stopped working after a week. Seemed to have faulty wiring from factory, speaker had buzzing sound out of box, then mic quit a week later. Got a replacement set, working fine so far but the headpiece is not very comfortable. I preferred the model with two earphones, more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rafe

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and very functional
customer_reviews.text: I use this for speech to text using Windows 10. It works very well and does not interfere with my other sound card settings. I unplug it when I am done and its settings disappear until the next time. It fits very snugly on your head.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Headset.  Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: I use this headset with my desktop to make phone calls.. I've gone through a lot of headsets and i received lots of complaints depending on the one i was using. No one even knows I'm wearing this headset the assume it's my cell phone. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jonal T Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for gaming! I can hear clearly and can be heard clearly. Comfortable, lightweight and easy to use. It is left or right ear compatible. Not plug and play compatible on my system but only took a few clicks to make it work. I actually have two of these now!
customer_reviews.author: MrsBuzzcut

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made USB
customer_reviews.text: This headset would get a good rating from me, IF the USB wasn't so cheaply made. I'm not even sure how, as I know I didn't tug the line, the metal bit of the USB popped right off and won't reconnect. :( Other than that the sound quality is great, and it's very light weight. If you can choose, get the version with the audio jacks instead.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Ali

customer_reviews.title: Listens better than my wife
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to work with some Dragon software I picked up for my Acer Aspire One netbook so I could dictate while I drive. Aside from looking like an absolute tool during my daily commute down the highway, talking to a headset to work, it picks up everything I say very distinctly, even in the car with all of the background noises of the highway and the stereo playing. While the accuracy drops a bit while in the car, it still manages to maintain a vast majority of the things spoken.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Grubbs

customer_reviews.title: Better Have a small head
customer_reviews.text: to small I have a size 6 7/8 head it hurts to wear it other then that it work as a low priced head set should be expedited. spend the money get a better headset
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Boocher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mic
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect. My fiance and I game next to each other so with the one ear piece we can hear each other. The sound quality in these is great, there is no static or weird background noise and they are comfortable for long periods of time. No pain on the side of my head and the speaker is comfortable. Also, the mic switches from left to right.
customer_reviews.author: RDaletto

customer_reviews.title: Not the most comfortable headset but it works and is a great backup ...
customer_reviews.text: Not the most comfortable headset but it works and is a great backup for when I'm working from home and don't have my primary wireless headset in the office.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I use a headset with microphone most of the time. The new Mac operating system allows voice dictation. This headphone allows me to use it without cutting me off totally from the rest of my family. Voice recognition seems to work fine one year is uncovered so that I can hear other people talking to me. The price was right and the delivery was very quick. I recommend both the seller and this product.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Very bad fit on head. Too tight.
customer_reviews.text: The problem with this headset is that it is like a vise on your head - it actually HURTS. I bent it out as far as I could without fear of breaking it and it is better but the fit is still terrible. I am very disappointed. I would return it if I did not need it.
customer_reviews.author: Avacal

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: The performance of the electronics is fine. The microphone records clearly and the earpiece is also clear. However, the headband is very uncomfortable (pressure on the side of the head) after just a short period of time, and gives me a headache if I have it on for more than an hour or so.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Bulka

customer_reviews.title: Easy Listening and hands free talking
customer_reviews.text: This headset is the best I've ever had and I have gone through a few. It is comfortable, even after hours of wear, the sound quality is great and what I like best about it is the microphone quality. It really cuts out the surrounding noises and transmits what you are saying. I use it for my voice recognition software and have to say it works fantastic. This is one item I can definitely recommend and I don't do that lightly.
customer_reviews.author: pegster

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and works well if you work at home and need a USB headset for call center work
customer_reviews.author: latrisha facio

customer_reviews.title: Good headset for the money
customer_reviews.text: This headset is a good value for the money. I have used others with Dragon NaturallySpeaking that have not worked quite as well as this one. This headset appears to cancel out more distracting noise interference, allowing for better dictation with less editing. This headset works better than headset provided by Dragon. I would definitely prefer others to this headset.
customer_reviews.author: Stubbs

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Price
customer_reviews.text: Good for what it is, which is a low-end, cheap, no-frills headset. Fits comfortably; I sometimes forget I'm wearing it. Sound is on the low side, though. It's definitely for conversation, not listening to music or movies. No static, feedback or buzz on bass sounds, which is nice. The cord keeps tangling, though, which is irritating
customer_reviews.author: Alikhat

customer_reviews.title: Keep Looking
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this headset to use with the computer. Three people (1 adult, 2 children) in my family complained that the part of the headset without the earphone pressed in to the side of their head and cause pain. There didn't seem to be a way to adjust it. The sound quality was ok.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Brodsky

customer_reviews.title: This is great as it enables me to use Google Voice on ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great as it enables me to use Google Voice on my computer when my husband is using our home phone. Very clear, easy to hear and speak.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Koss Communications USB Headset with Microphone (CS95-USB),White
product_meta.description: Style:CS95-USBThe Koss CS95 USB communication headset boasts a full range of sound that brings conversations to life. High noise sensitivity and reduced sound distortion, combined with hands-free communication via an electret noise cancelling microphone, brings clarity to the task at hand. This single-sided headset allows you to easily communicate while staying aware of your surroundings. The USB plug provides quick and easy connection to your PC. Whether your primary use is for telecommunications, voice-activated software programs or indulging in multi-player video games, the CS95 USB headset offers long-lasting comfort and crystal clear communication. Communication made easy, with the Koss CS95 USB.
feature_bullets: Headset with electret, noise-reduction Microphone for hands-free communication from PCs
Headset with electret, noise reduction microphone for hands-free communication from your PC
Ideal for PC voice applications, interactive gaming & speech recognition
Dynamic element for extended frequency response
Foam ear cushions for open, hear-through sound
Adjustable headband for a great fit
Headset with electret, noise reduction microphone for hands-free communication from your PC
Ideal for PC voice applications, interactive gaming & speech recognition
Dynamic element for extended frequency response
Foam ear cushions for open, hear-through sound
Adjustable headband for a great fit
